citation.article-title: Paenibacillus koleovorans sp. nov., able to grow on the sheath of Sphaerotilus natans.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Paenibacillus koleovorans sp. nov.
Paenibacillus koleovorans (ko.le.o.vo'rans. Gr. n. koleon sheath; L. v. voro to devour, N.L. part. adj. koleovorans sheath-devouring)
Cells are rod-shaped (0.4-0.7x1-3.2 μm).
Motile cells are observed in the early stages of cultivation grown on the sheath of Sphaerotilus natans.
Ellipsoidal spores are formed in swollen sporangia.
Facultatively anaerobic and Gram-negative.
Two types of creamy-grey colonies are formed when grown on tryptone: one is flat and translucent and the other is convex and opaque.
Optimum growth temperature is 30 °C.
Optimum pH is 7.
Growth does not occur in the presence of 5% (w/v) NaCl.
No growth in nutrient broth.
Catalase, urease and oxidase activities are negative.
Gelatin is not hydrolysed.
Citrate and glucose are not utilized.
Arginine dihydrolase, ornithine decarboxylase and lysine decarboxylase are negative.
Nitrate is not reduced.
Indole is not produced.
The Voges-Proskauer reaction is negative.
The sheath of Sphaerotilus natans is degraded and utilized.
Most carbohydrates, organic acids and amino acids are not oxidized, as described above.
Predominant fatty acids are anteiso-C15:0, C16:0 and C15:0.
The major isoprenoid quinone is MK-7.
The G­C content is 54.0-55.8 mol%.
The PAEN515F binding site exists in the 16S rRNA gene.
The type strain is strain TBT (=JCM 11186T=IAM 14926T=KCTC 13912T).
